Surely you just need to replicate the Platform isRunning code from the constructor of JavaModelManager transitively in everything that it now invokes, which might be easier by just moving JavaModelManager's field construction from field initializers to the main constructor?
Otherwise as a regression reported within 48 hours, shouldn't you back out the edit?
Since the fix made to bug 376724 didn't fix the original bug 367669, I am inclined to revert the fix and investigate the issues reported in bug 376724 later.

(In reply to comment #3) > Since the fix made to bug 376724 didn't fix the original bug 367669, I am > inclined to revert the fix and investigate the issues reported in bug 376724 > later.

(In reply to comment #2) > which might be easier by just moving JavaModelManager's field construction from > field initializers to the main constructor?
Okay, I will go with this. Doesn't sound like risky at all.

Created attachment 214661 Draft patch
The fix should be somewhat like this. But I need to test few things before calling it final. For instance, the JavaModelManager#indexManager, which is instantiated after a isRunning() call - we use this without a null check. Theoretically, we could run in to NPE.
Patch looks good at sight, but let me look at it a little more.

Created attachment 214665 Updated patch
This one makes me feel more comfortable. Moved the isRunning check to ExternalFoldersManager, to ensure that JavaModelManager#externalFoldersManager is always non-null.
Srikanth, can you review this patch, please?
